question: Is the Pennie Producer training and exam the same as what CMS requires to operate on healthcare.gov?
text:
Is the Pennie Producer training and exam the same as what CMS requires to operate on healthcare.gov? 
          
        
Pennsylvania producers deserve a training that is unique to the people they serve throughout the Commonwealth, and that is what Pennie through its partnership with 
PSI Learning Academy
 has endeavored to provide. This training is required for producers to be Pennie-certified. 

Unlike the CMS training, this training is Pennsylvania and Pennie-specific, and the content has been reduced by 40% to be more streamlined. There is also a systems-training module designed to make it easy for producers to log-in and serve their customers on the Pennie platform. The scoring for the comprehensive exam has also changed. Producers must score at least 80% to pass the course but can take the test as many times as necessary to pass. There are 50 questions,each worth 2 points.
